channel.title: Python on Million on Mars
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Million on Mars

item.title: Post Pycon Follow-up
item.description: Security We need 2F across our github, website (and me for the banks) Buy a set of these: Yubico Checkout lastpass Static Site Learn which farking css file controls what and when Design our site Implement the design Pull the Hugo docs locally Find our static website provider 21 best yCombo static conv Remove our gitbuh static website and replace with a re-direct to million on mars Solve Jupiter notebooks smashing over current python environment Google Site Ownership Collect all my domains Packaging Work to help the Kivy packaging docs to be cleaner Learn virtual environment documentation Testing Check out mypy Read pytest’s documents PyTest Docs Read and so the examples of Obey the Testing Goat prcheck-py2: prcheck: prcheck-py2 typecheck pydocstyle pyflakes doc8 travis for continuous integratuon chalice repro github.

item.title: Day 4 - PyCon 2018 Session Notes
item.description: Effortless Logging: A deep dive into the logging module Mario Corchoro Bloomberg @mariocj89 If you use a debugger -> you are doing it wrong. Because how will you fix it in production when you cannot use the debugger? Split how to what Collaborative approach Great for libraries logger logger.info(“hello %s”, something) log record emit(record) handler format string logger = logging.getLogger(“parent.child”) logging.getLogger(name) << uses the file’s name & makes sense logging.

item.title: Kyle and Max Demoing Million on Mars
item.description: Without any warning or preperation, I had Kyle and Max start showing off their work on Million on Mars to the various folks running booths here at PyCon 2018. They did about 20 presentations over the 3 days: Google, Microsoft, Amazon, heroku, JetBrains, and even the creator Python Guido van Rossum all checked out the gameplay. By a happy stroke of timing, Max on his own, produced a time-lapsed video of 10 minutes of gameplay and it turned out to be an excellent demo asset.

item.title: Day 3 - PyCon 2018 Session Notes
item.description: LED lights Lady Red mCScope@gmail.com github.com/msscope mcscope/liteup NeoPixel 3528 5050 SMD LED WS2812D Works good with Arduino microcontrollers Hard to use with Rasberry PI APA102 (DotStar) Data and Clock seperate 2 wire SPI Much faster clock 32 mHz vz 800 khz pure python controller Black 5m 30 IP67 30 IP30 Indoor 60 IP65 Water Resistent 144 IP 67 Immersible <<< cool! RGBW (white) RGBWW (warm white) Where to buy LEDs?

item.title: Day 2 - PyCon 2018 Session Notes
Day 1 - PyCon 2018 Session Notes
item.description: Django - API driven DJango Project Lots of docs here Great book on TDD for Django Stopped at chapter 5 Google Cloud Services @jonparrott @briandorsey Global 99.95% availability $0.026 GB/month Regional $0.02 GB/month Long Term Storage - Backups Forever Log $0.01 - 1x to push $0.01 - 1x cost to pull back Cold Storage $0.007 GB/month $0.05 to pull Great Tools Jypiter - cool python journalining notebooks jupyter gsutil timed URLs - option on expiring your links to other users Google Cloud Products ** NOTE: HAMBURGER Menu is key!

item.title: Cancun to Clevend for PyCon 2018
item.description: The happy geek factor is huge right now. Kyle, Max and I are flying to Cleveland, Ohio from Cancun to attend PyCon 2018. Max is coding his text-based RPG, and I am learning & building our new HUGO-powered blog. I am having an breakfast IPA, Max a breakfast Coke. Yesterday I went through all of the speakers and there are a lot of great talks I am looking forward to attending.
